certificate_findings: Application is signed with a code signing certificate

Application is signed with v1 signature scheme, making it vulnerable to Janus vulnerability on Android 5.0-8.0, if signed only with v1 signature scheme. Applications running on Android 5.0-7.0 signed with v1, and v2/v3 scheme is also vulnerable.
Application is signed with SHA1withRSA. SHA1 hash algorithm is known to have collision issues.
Certificate algorithm might be vulnerable to hash collision

manifest_analysis.title:
Application Data can be Backed up
[android:allowBackup=true]
manifest_analysis.desc: This flag allows anyone to backup your application data via adb. It allows users who have enabled USB debugging to copy application data off of the device.
manifest_analysis.name: Application Data can be Backed up [android:allowBackup=true]

nx.description: The shared object has NX bit set. This marks a memory page non-executable making attacker injected shellcode non-executable.

stack_canary.description: This shared object has a stack canary value added to the stack so that it will be overwritten by a stack buffer that overflows the return address. This allows detection of overflows by verifying the integrity of the canary before function return.

relocation_readonly.description: This shared object has full RELRO enabled. RELRO ensures that the GOT cannot be overwritten in vulnerable ELF binaries. In Full RELRO, the entire GOT (.got and .got.plt both) is marked as read-only.

rpath.description: The shared object does not have run-time search path or RPATH set.

runpath.description: The shared object does not have RUNPATH set.

fortify.description: The shared object does not have any fortified functions. Fortified functions provides buffer overflow checks against glibc's commons insecure functions like strcpy, gets etc. Use the compiler option -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 to fortify functions.

stack_canary.description: This shared object has a stack canary value added to the stack so that it will be overwritten by a stack buffer that overflows the return address. This allows detection of overflows by verifying the integrity of the canary before function return.

relocation_readonly.description: This shared object has partial RELRO enabled. RELRO ensures that the GOT cannot be overwritten in vulnerable ELF binaries. In partial RELRO, the non-PLT part of the GOT section is read only but .got.plt is still writeable. Use the option -z,relro,-z,now to enable full RELRO.

metadata.cwe: CWE-330: Use of Insufficiently Random Values
metadata.description: The App uses an insecure Random Number Generator.

metadata.cwe: CWE-532: Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File
metadata.description: The App logs information. Sensitive information should never be logged.
App creates temp file. Sensitive information should never be written into a temp file.
App can read/write to External Storage. Any App can read data written to External Storage.

metadata.cwe: CWE-312: Cleartext Storage of Sensitive Information
metadata.description: Files may contain hardcoded sensitive information like usernames, passwords, keys etc.

FCS_RBG_EXT.1.1.choice: The application use no DRBG functionality for its cryptographic operations.

FCS_STO_EXT.1.1.choice: The application does not store any credentials to non-volatile memory.

FCS_CKM_EXT.1.1.choice: The application generate no asymmetric cryptographic keys.

FDP_DEC_EXT.1.1.choice: The application has access to no hardware resources.

FDP_DEC_EXT.1.2.choice: The application has access to no sensitive information repositories.

FDP_NET_EXT.1.1.choice: The application has no network communications.

FDP_DAR_EXT.1.1.choice: The application does not encrypt files in non-volatile memory.

FMT_MEC_EXT.1.1.choice: The application invoke the mechanisms recommended by the platform vendor for storing and setting configuration options.

FTP_DIT_EXT.1.1.choice: The application does not encrypt any data in traffic or does not transmit any data between itself and another trusted IT product.

strings:
"table1_rules" : "Table Rules:
- Light all the cyan rollovers in the top or bottom lanes to advance the score multiplier. All points you earn will be multiplied by this amount. Shooting the left ramp will also advance the multiplier.
- The game starts with ball savers in the left and right outlanes, which disappear when used. Hit all drop targets on the left or right side to restore them.
- Hitting any group of drop targets will activate the next light in the center of the field. When the large white central light is activated, shoot the left ramp to start multiball."

"table5_rules" : "Table Rules:
- The central circle has twelve points around it, 3 each of 4 colors. Shooting a top ramp will change the color of the ball and allow it to activate the points with matching color.
- When all 12 points around the circle are activated, hitting the edges of the rotating triangle will remove them. Shoot the target in the middle of the triangle to start multiball.
- During multiball, light the 12 circle points again to score a jackpot, which increases in value each time.
- The game starts with ball savers in the left and right outlanes, which disappear when used. Hit all drop targets on the left or right side to restore them."
"independent_flippers_pref_summary_on" : "Un appui active le flipper du même côté de l'écran"

"table3_rules" : "Table Rules:
- Light all the cyan rollovers in the bottom lanes to advance the score multiplier. All points you earn will be multiplied by this amount. 
- The game starts with ball savers in the left and right outlanes, which disappear when used. Hit all drop targets on the left or right side to restore them.
- Shooting either ramp with turn the bumpers red, and they will change back to blue over several seconds. Hit them during this time for extra points.
- Turn the middle rings red by hitting the bumpers, and the middle sets of drop targets. When all the rings are red, shoot either ramp to start multiball."
"independent_flippers_pref_summary_on" : "A touch activates the flippers on the same side of the screen"

"table4_rules" : "Table Rules:
- Each bumper increases the score multiplier by 0.01x. Shooting the top drop targets or lighting all the lane rollovers will increase this amount.
- Shoot all six bumpers to light the center indicators. When all indicators for a row are lit, shoot the right hole to lock the ball for multiball.
- Multiball starts when you lock three balls. During multiball, the center indicators will light up when a ball crosses over them. Light them all to score a jackpot.
- The game starts with ball savers in the left and right outlanes, which disappear when used. Hit all drop targets on the left or right side to restore them."

"table2_rules" : "Table Rules:
- Light all the cyan rollovers in the bottom lanes to advance the score multiplier. All points you earn will be multiplied by this amount. 
- The game starts with ball savers in the left and right outlanes, which disappear when used. Hit all drop targets on the left or right side to restore them.
- The circles in the middle of the field keep track of how many times you've hit all the left, upper, and right drop targets. When all of them have been hit at least 3 times, shoot the red bumper in the upper right to start multiball."

"about_text" : "Vector Pinball 1.5.6
© 2010-2016 Brian Nenninger
More info: www.vectorpinball.com
Comments and bug reports: brian@vectorpinball.com

Touch the screen to start a new game, launch a ball if one is not in play, and activate the flippers. Touch the score area to pause the game.

[TABLE_RULES]

Selecting the Preferences button or menu item allows you to change the following settings:
- Sound: Enables and disables sound effects
- Background Music: Enables and disabled background music
- Independent Flippers: When unchecked, any touch activates both flippers. When checked, you must touch the left side of the screen for the left flipper, and the right side for the right flipper.
- Zoom: When checked, the view will be zoomed on the ball's location during game play.
- OpenGL Rendering: Uses OpenGL to draw graphics. This improves performance on many devices, but slows down some.
- Show FPS: When checked, shows frames drawn per second in the upper left.

Vector Pinball is open source; the code is at https://github.com/dozingcat/Vector-Pinball

Thanks to Mario at www.badlogicgames.com for code improvements and libgdx.

sound, music, & audio code, by pdx
Twittering Machine
http://www.twittering.com"

high.title: Application vulnerable to Janus Vulnerability
high.description: Application is signed with v1 signature scheme, making it vulnerable to Janus vulnerability on Android 5.0-8.0, if signed only with v1 signature scheme. Applications running on Android 5.0-7.0 signed with v1, and v2/v3 scheme is also vulnerable.

high.title: Certificate algorithm might be vulnerable to hash collision
high.description: Application is signed with SHA1withRSA. SHA1 hash algorithm is known to have collision issues.

warning.title: Application Data can be Backed up
warning.description:
[android:allowBackup=true]
This flag allows anyone to backup your application data via adb. It allows users who have enabled USB debugging to copy application data off of the device.

warning.title: The App uses an insecure Random Number Generator.
warning.description:
The App uses an insecure Random Number Generator.
https://github.com/MobSF/owasp-mstg/blob/master/Document/0x04g-Testing-Cryptography.md#weak-random-number-generators

warning.title: App creates temp file. Sensitive information should never be written into a temp file.
warning.description: App creates temp file. Sensitive information should never be written into a temp file.

warning.title: App can read/write to External Storage. Any App can read data written to External Storage.
warning.description:
App can read/write to External Storage. Any App can read data written to External Storage.
https://github.com/MobSF/owasp-mstg/blob/master/Document/0x05d-Testing-Data-Storage.md#external-storage

warning.title: Files may contain hardcoded sensitive information like usernames, passwords, keys etc.
warning.description:
Files may contain hardcoded sensitive information like usernames, passwords, keys etc.
https://github.com/MobSF/owasp-mstg/blob/master/Document/0x05d-Testing-Data-Storage.md#checking-memory-for-sensitive-data-mstg-storage-10

info.title: The App logs information. Sensitive information should never be logged.
info.description:
The App logs information. Sensitive information should never be logged.
https://github.com/MobSF/owasp-mstg/blob/master/Document/0x05d-Testing-Data-Storage.md#logs

secure.title: This application has no privacy trackers
secure.description: This application does not include any user or device trackers. Unable to find trackers during static analysis.
